alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 5:16AM CST until January 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Crittenden, Cross, Mississippi, Poinsett and St. Francis. In West Tennessee, Lauderdale and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 815 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 516 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forrest City, Wynne, Osceola, Marked Tree, Earle, Lepanto, Luxora, Parkin, Wilson, Tyronza, Keiser, Palestine, Village Creek State Park, Fort Pillow State Park, Cherry Valley, Joiner, Caldwell, Dyess, Colt and Wheatley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
